verses.verse: I made a covenant with my eyes, and how could I look intently on a virgin?
For what is the portion from God above, and what is the legacy from the Almighty on high?
Is it not disaster to the perverse one, and calamity to the workers of iniquity?
Does He not see my ways and count all my steps?
If I have walked with vanity, or my foot has hurried to deceit,
let me be weighed in just scales, and that God may know my integrity.
If my step has turned aside out of the way, or my heart has walked after my eyes, and if any spot has clung to my palm,
let me sow, and let another eat; and let my offspring be uprooted.
If my heart has been enticed by a woman; or I laid in wait at my neighbor's door,
let my wife grind to another, and let others crouch over her.
For that would be an evil purpose, and it is iniquity for the judges.
For it is a fire that devours to the Place of Ruin, and it would root up all my gain.
If I rejected the cause of my male slave or my slave-girl when they contended with me,
what then shall I do when God rises up? And when He calls me up, what shall I answer Him?
Did not He who made me in the belly make him? And did not One shape us in the womb?
If I have withheld from the desire of the poor one, or I have consumed the widow's eyes,
or have eaten my bit alone, and the orphan has not eaten from it,
for from my youth he grew up with me as with a father, and from my mother's womb I guided her.
If I have seen any perish for lack of clothing, or there was no covering for the needy one;
if his loins have not blessed me, and he warmed himself with the fleece of my flock;
if I have lifted up my hand against the orphan, when I saw my help in the gate;
let my shoulder fall from the blade, and let my arm be broken from the bone.
For calamity from God is a terror to me, and I could not do the thing because of His majesty.
If I have made gold my hope or have said fine gold is my trust;
if I rejoiced because my wealth was great; or because my hand had found much;
if I looked to the light when it shone, or the moon walking in splendor,
and my heart was secretly enticed, or my mouth has kissed my hand;
this also would be an iniquity for the judges; for I would have denied God above.
If I rejoiced at the ruin of one hating me, and I was excited when evil found him;
also I have not given my mouth to sin by asking his life with a curse;
if the men of my tent did not say, Who can give; not being satisfied from his flesh?
The stranger did not lodge outside, for I opened my doors to the traveler;
if I covered my transgressions like Adam, by hiding my iniquity in my bosom,
then let me fear before a great multitude, and let the contempt of families frighten me and I will be silent, and not go out the door.
Oh that to me were one to listen to me! Behold my mark! Let the Almighty answer me, and let the Man of my contention write an indictment.
Surely I would carry it on my shoulder, and bind it like crowns to me.
I would tell Him the number of my steps. Like a prince I would come near Him.
If my land cries out against me, or its furrows weep together;
if I have eaten its strength without silver, or have caused the life of its owner to breathe out,
let thorns come forth instead of wheat, and a weed instead of barley. The words of Job are finished.
